name: my_strcpy
description: Write a function that copies a string into another. The destination string will already have enough memory to copy the source string.

name: my_strncpy
description: Write a function that copies n characters from a string into another. The destination string will already have enough memory to contain n characters.

name: my_revstr
description: Write a function that reverses a string.

name: my_strstr
description: Reproduce the behavior of the strstr function

name: my_strcmp
description: Reproduce the behavior of the strcmp function.

name: my_strncmp
prototype: int my_strncmp(char const *s1, char const *s2, int n);
description: Reproduce the behavior of the strncmp function.

name: my_strupcase
description: Write a function that puts every letter of every word in it in uppercase.

name: my_strlowcase
description: Write a function that puts every letter of every word in it in lowercase.

name: my_strcapitalize
description: Write a function that capitalizes the first letter of each word.

name: my_str_isalpha
description: Write a function that returns 1 if the string passed as parameter only contains alphabetical characters and 0 if the string contains another type of character

name: my_str_isnum
description: Write a function that returns 1 if the string passed as parameter only contains digits and 0 otherwise.

name: my_str_islower
description: Write a function that returns 1 if the string passed as parameter only contains lowercase alphabetical characters and 0 otherwise.

name: my_str_isupper
description: Write a function that returns 1 if the string passed as parameter only contains uppercase alphabetical characters and 0 otherwise.

name: my_str_isprintable
description: Write a function that returns 1 if the string passed as parameter only contains printable characters and 0 otherwise.

name: my_putnbr_base
description: Write a function that converts and displays a decimal number into a number in a given base. The number is given as an int and the base is provided as a string. The base contains all the symbols that can be used to print a number (for instance, 0123456789 for the decimal base, 01 for the binary base, 0123456789ABCDEF for the hexadecimal base).

name: my_getnbr_base

name: my_showstr
description: Write a function that prints a string and returns 0. If this string contains non-printable characters, they must be printed hexadecimally (in lowercase letters) with a backslash before the given value.

name: my_showmem
description: Write a function that prints a memory dump and return 0.
